reviewText:
Movie Title #1: BABY CAT
Description: "The life of a Parisian photo model turns into a nightmare when her amorous former photographer begins to pursue her constantly, even after she refuses his offers."
Genre: Comedy
Runtime: 90 mins.
Rating: NR (Adult Content)

Movie Title #2: BOTTOMS UP
Description: "A skinny, virginal mechanic is taken into erotic captivity by three lovely nymphs who decide to give him an enlightening course in sex education. Their goal: to transform a naive nerd into a sexual dynamo for the voluptuous Girty."
Genre: Comedy
Runtime: 90 mins.
Rating: R

Movie Title #3: MAD MAD MOVIEMAKERS
Description: "In this ridiculously silly film, a pair of two-bit movie producers are looking to make it rich by cashing in on the successful adult film 'Deep Throat' craze. They receive financial support of their friends and family by claiming that they're making a religious film. Hilarity ensues when their production becomes an unforeseen success!"
Genre: Comedy
Runtime: 90 mins.
Rating: PG

Movie Title #4: THE SWINGIN' STEWARDESSES
Description: "This 70s sex comedy chronicles the exploits of several flight attendants whose favorite perk-of-the-trade is the ability to flit from one sexual adventure to the next. The mile high club takes on a new meaning as the swinging' German heroines make their way throughout Europe."
Genre: Comedy
Runtime: 80 mins.
Rating: NR (Adult Content)

DVD Release Date:2006
Label: BCI Eclipse

It's doubtful you'll see the four titles on BRENTWOOD's SINS OF SHOWBIZ 4 Movie Pack available anywhere else-- but this may be a good thing. Can't say much about "Swinging Stewardesses" - that title doesn't exist at such movie reference sites like IMDB.com. Must be a biggie. "Bottoms Up" looks like an Aussie nerd's wet dream: three hot babes kidnap a loser-in-love engineer and tutor the nebbish in the Kama Sutra. "Mad Mad Moviemakers" back in 1974 took advantage of Peter Bogdonovich's "Last Picture Show" with its original title: "The Last Porno Flick." Flick's plot is a minor ripoff of Mel Brooks' "The Producers." Here, two young men convince their families to finance what their unsuspecting folks believe is a religious movie. When the cheezy sexcapade they create becomes a big hit, our moviemaker heroes have a lot of explaining to do. "Baby Cat" is made in France. The title puts one in mind of a Pepe Le Pew cartoon (emphasis on the "Pew"). Here, a fashion model can't get away from a photog who once did a shoot with her. For well-made sexy movies, recommended is BOMBSHELLS OF THE SILVER SCREEN 4 Movie Pack (also from BRENTWOOD). These mid-20th Century European films feature stars like Sophia Loren, Gina Lollobrigida, Virna Lisi and Brigitte Bardot. . Parenthetical numbers preceding titles are 1 to 10 viewer poll ratings found at a film resource website. (3.0) Baby Cat (France-1983) - Julie Margo/Corinne Corson (1.2) Bottoms Up ("What a Way to Go") (Australia-1977) - Adam Janas/Sparky Abbrams (5.4) Mad Mad Moviemakers ("The Last Porno Flick") (1974) - Frank Calcanini/Colleen Camp (???) The Swinging Stewardesses (1972) - ???

2 movies to a disc side on this colection.  None are great movies, but there is plenty of T&A for the perverts.  Two of these films (Bottom's Up and The Swinging Stewardesses) looked like a slightly edited porno film (removing the penetration scenes.) Baby Cat contained minor T&A.  I have not seen Mad Mad Moviemakers yet, but considering it is rated PG, I doubt it has any nudity.
